SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Eicher Motors Limited has informed the Exchange that Due to heavy rains and flooding in Chennai, both of Royal Enfield's production facilities in Thiruvottiyur and Oragadam were shut between the 1st and 6th of December 2015. Company resumed production of motorcycles on December 7, 2015 with Company manufacturing facilities operating at 50% of our installed capacity. Over the course of the last week Company production rates improved steadily as Company facilities, employees and suppliers recovered from the aftermath of the floods. As of Monday, the December 14, 2015, Company is back to normal at our plants, and are running at 100% of the companies installed capacity at Royal Enfield. Company continue to monitor the situation closely and work in the best interest of our employees, customers, business partners and the larger eco-system in Chennai.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Eicher Motors Limited has informed the Exchange vide letter dated December 07, 2015 that "Due to heavy rains and flooding in Chennai, both of Royal Enfield's production facilities in Thiruvottiyur and Oragadam were shut since the 1st of December 2015. We resumed production of motorcycles on December 7, 2015. However, due to a high rate of absenteeism by our employees, and issues with our local suppliers - we will be running at approximately 50% capacity this week, and plan to be back up to 100% capacity by next week. Prima facie, there is no damage to equipment or property and all our employees are safe and secure. We have had production loss of 7200 motorcycles due to the closure of both our manufacturing facilities between December 1- 6, 2015. Many parts of the supply chain still continue to be affected due to the aftermath of floods. Due to the rains, in November we lost production of 4000 motorcycles. We continue to monitor the situation closely and work in the best interest of all our stakeholders. We would be able to assess the insurance loss in due course, once the full normalcy is restored".

As a consequence, we have shut down our offices in the city and our plants in Thiruvottiyur and Oragadam since December 1st. Due to the rains, in November we lost production of 4000 motorcycles. We are working to ensurethat all our employees are safe. We are monitoring the situation closely and hoping for normalcy to return soon".

DETAILS: Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that further to the resolution of the Board of Directors dated May 25, 2005, the Company has on May 27, 2005, entered into definitive agreements with TMTL in connection with the slump sale, on a 'going concern' basis, of the tractors, engines and gears divisions of the Company at Mandideep, Alwar and Parwanoo, respectively.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the BODs of the company has, at its meeting held on May 25, 2005:  1) Subject to approval of the shareholders of the Company, approved the slump sale (as defined in section 2(42C) of the Income Tax Act, 1961), on a 'going concern' basis, of the tractors, engines and gears divisions of the Company at Mandideep, Alwar and Parwanoo, respectively, to TAFE Motors and Tractors Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of Tractors and Farm Equipment Limited, for a total consideration of Rs.310 crores (the "Transaction)  (a) Approved the agreed drafts of the agreements for the transaction and authorized certain officers of the company to execute necessary documents in this regard;  (b) Resolved to seek approval of the shareholders of the company pursuant to section 293(1)(a) of the Companies Act, 1956, as amended, by way of a postal ballot, for the proposed Transaction; 2) The Board also approved the investment upto USD 2.5 million, subject to compliance with applicable laws, for acquisition of a US based company engaged in computer aided engineering and design services. Pursuant to the proposed acquisition, the said company would become a wholly owned subsidiary of the company.

SUBJECT: Limited Review Report
DETAILS: Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the auditor's have conducted the limited review of the unaudited financial results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2004 and found the same to be in order subject to certain observations. The auditor's observations are: Pursuant to Notification No. CE(NT) - 11/95 dated March 16, 1995 issued by the Central Government, unutilized MODVAT balance amounting to Rs.821 lacs standing to the credit of the Company as on March 16, 1995 was to lapse. On a writ petition filed by the Company, the Hon'ble Supreme Court struck down the aforesaid notification. Subsequently, section 37 of the Central Excise Act, 1944 was amended by the Finance Act, 1999 with retrospective effect from March 16, 1995 to validate the said notification. The Company has challenged the aforesaid amendment before the Delhi High Court. Pending disposal of the case, no provision is considered necessary in respect of the MODVAT balance of Rs.821 lacs lying unutilized as on March 16, 1995.
